results.title: The Man from Snowy River
results.brief_description: The Man From Snowy River, based on the classic Australian poem by Banjo Patterson, tells the story of an 18 year old boy who proves himself a man during an unforgettable chase on horseback down the rugged Snowy Mountains and becomes a legend. The most magnificent footage of horses ever filmed.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

results.title: The Man from Maisinicu = El hombre de Maisinicu
results.creator_credit: ICAIC, Santiago Llapur and Manuel Perez
results.brief_description: A film of adventure, armed combat and political intrigue, ‘The Man from Maisinicu’ depicts the life of a man who tries to bring the calming effects of sound farm management into the midst of the fray. The film is set in the Escambray Mountains in early 1964, then the scene of intense conflict between peasant farmers of the region and the counterrevolutionary bands spreading terror amongst the local population while trying to re-establish contact with the CIA. Amidst a backdrop of political intrigue and espionage, Alberto Delgado y Delgado was sent to manage the Maisinicu Co-operative Farm. When his body was found in a clearing in the nearby woods, an investigation was launched and the resulting story of his last 14 months forms the basis of the film, told in flashback. Cast includes Sergio Corrieri, Reinaldo Miravalles, Raul Romanes. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: The Man from Laramie
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, William Goetz and Anthony Mann
results.brief_description: Anthony Mann’s classic western tells the story of Will Lockhart (James Stewart) and his search for revenge for the death of his youngest brother. He leaves Laramie in search of the men who sold automatic rifles to the Apache tribe which killed his brother. He arrives in Coronado and is soon embroilled in a bitter battle with the Waggoman family who own most of the land and cattle in the township. Full of great characters and twists in plot, “The Man From Laramie” is an enthralling film with characters who defy simplistic moralistic platitutes.

results.title: The Man from kangaroo (1920)
results.creator_credit: E.J. Carroll, Reg L Baker and Wilfrid Lucas
results.brief_description: This film, starring “Snowy Baker”, is about John Harland, a pugilist turned parson, who is posted to the town of Kangaroo where a gang of thugs has driven the Church out of the area. Harland defies the gang by holding a service in the Town Hall but it is disrupted by threats of violence. In defeat, Harland seeks a job as a stationhand and discovers that his sweetheart, Muriel owns a neighbouring property and that her overseer is none other than Red Jack Braggan, the leader of the gang. Red Jack kidnaps Muriel, but after many fights and chases she is rescued by Harland and the town is rid of its rowdy element.

results.title: The Man from East Liverpool: Ben Feldman
results.creator_credit: Jay J Sheridan and Company and Jay J. Sheridan
results.brief_description: Instructional film on salesmanship and setting goals for yourself. Uses Insurance salesman Ben Feldman as the focus. He gives a background of himself and how he got to where he is today. He is shown in action conducting sales in real scenarios demonstrating the attitudes needed to achieve personal success.

results.title: The Man and the snake
results.creator_credit: Jocelyn Films, Elizabeth McKay and Sture Rydman
results.brief_description: Presents a story of a young man’s visit to the home of a zoologist who keeps and studies snakes. Based on the story of the same title by ambrose Bierce. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Man and the giant: an Eskimo legend
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Department of Indian Affairs and Northern Development, Pierre Moretti and Co Hoedeman
results.brief_description: This film is based on an Inuit legend and performed by the Inuit people themselves. There is no dialogue, but the action is punctuated by ‘katadjak’, or throatsinging, a traditional form of singing once widely practised by the Inuit but now mostly confined to the Eastern Arctic. Camera by Andre Dupont, editing by J. Richard Robesco, Eskimo sound effects by Aikimie Novalinga and soapstone carvings by Paulosie Sivuak.

results.title: The Mammalian story: the beginning of life (Japan)
results.creator_credit: Rokuro Hayashi, Cine-science and Jun-Ichiro Takeda
results.brief_description: Examines the development of the mammal. Considers aspects of cell division and the nature of chromosomes and heredity. Looks in detail at the reproductive organs of the male and female, fertilization and the growth of the embryo. This film makes excellent use of photomicrography to record development of the embryo. Narrated by Brian McInerney.

results.title: The Mammalian heart
results.creator_credit: Educational Media International, Australian Academy of Science, D Moyan and A K Lee
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “The Web of life”.
Illustrates the structure and functioning of the mammalian heart by using the hearts of a sheep and a dog as examples. The sheep’s heart is used to show external features and internal structure, while the appearance of a living heart is seen during a chest operation on a dog at a veterinary clinic. The passage of blood through the heart, lungs and major vessels is observed through X-ray process. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Mambo kings
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, La Studia Canal, Regency Enterprises, Alcor Films, Arnon Milchan and Arne Glimcher
results.brief_description: It is the early fifties and with a suitcase full of songs and hearts full of passion, two brothers leave Cuba and come to America in search of their Dream. They start a band and play the Mambo, Samba and Cha-cha in a nightclub every night. This is the story of their quest for show business fame based on the Pulitzer Prize winning “The Mambo Kings play Songs of Love” by Oscar Hjuelos. This film abounds with exciting Latin American music and fascinating footage of the “I Love Lucy” show is matched with footage of the brothers when their big break arrives. Stars Armand Assante and Antonio Banderas.
